items.content:
I have an opportunity for a Salesforce Developer to join a financial services business based in Desside.

The ideal candidate will not only be comfortable rolling up their sleeves but also discussing and demonstrating all aspects of the platform including solutions for administration, configuration and integration that support business requirements and process for continuous improvement.

Key Responsibilities May Include:
  • Ownership of technology solution and delivery of solutions to clients
  • Deliver solutions and perform ongoing Salesforce Administration such as create accounts/profiles, reports, dashboards etc.
  • Reviewing business, functional and technical requirements
  • Contribute to integrations, customizations and configurations
  • Create and maintain documentation on processes, application configuration
  • Recommend and implement enhancements, new features, functionality and tools to improve adoption, usability and integration with other systems
  • Define, document, negotiate, communicate, own and deliver a platform roadmap, from implementing new features, refactoring existing architecture and collaborate with business leaders to bring prototypes into a complete state.
  • Utilize functional knowledge of Salesforce.com (data structure, configurations, customizations and understanding of how to leverage the tool) to build solutions that meet complex business needs
  • Provide project management support

Required Skills/Qualifications:
  • 3+ years of Salesforce Development experience
  • Apex programming language experience
  • Salesforce Flow
  • Salesforce Process Builder
  • Visualforce pages
  • Understanding of Salesforce’s multi-tenant architecture
  • Salesforce Lightning Experience
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented sale-driven environment
  • Time management, ability to multitask and propensity to handle urgent interrupts with poise and professionalism
  • Collaboration and the ability to work effectively with internal/external customers as well as across the entire Sales Operations team are essential

Preferred Skills/Qualifications:
  • Experience of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Proficiency in use of Eclipse or Visual Studio Code as an IDE
  • Experience of GIT, or similar source control system
  • Previous experience of working as part of an Agile project
  • Salesforce Administrator/Developer Certification preferred
  • Experience of building bespoke lightning components

The salary for the position is £50-60,000 plus an excellent benefits package including remote working (possibly 100%), bonus scheme, 25 days holiday, 4% pension, life assurance x4 and healthcare plan.

Please call Jonathan Maironis at Opus RS in Manchester on 0161 249 7242 for more information or send your latest CV to jonathan dot maironis at opusrs dot com
Deeside
Permanent
£50,000 - £60,000 a year

items.title: Ksplice @ Oracle | Full Time | Remote | https://ksplice.oracle.com/ The Ksplice group at Oracle ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=1, dotnet=0, c=13, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Ksplice @ Oracle | Full Time | Remote | https://ksplice.oracle.com/

The Ksplice group at Oracle develops technology to patch the Linux kernel and applications while they are running, eliminating unplanned downtime for systems running Oracle Linux and keeping up-to-date with known security fixes. We're looking for a full stack software engineer and a systems engineer to join our team.

The full stack software engineer will help us expand the web services we provide to our customers and the tools needed to provide those services. You must be comfortable with the entire stack, from the Linux shell at the bottom to Python and Django (or similar) at the top (bonus points for experience with Terraform or Ansible). You must also be willing to assist with operational tasks. Expert knowledge of Python and web development as well as experience deploying to Linux is a must. Contact travis.jensen@oracle.com.

The systems engineer will help us Ksplice patch even more of the system, support new releases and improve our workflow. You'll like working at all levels of a Linux system, developing tooling in Python+bash, analyzing security vulnerabilities in Linux kernel patches, enhancing the Ksplice tools and improving the workflow. Expert level C/C++ programming, experience developing the Linux kernel and an understanding of security issues and defences in compiled languages are required. Contact jamie.iles@oracle.com.

More information about Ksplice is available at http://ksplice.oracle.com/. Oracle is an equal opportunity employer.

items.content:
Oracle | Software Engineer | Oakland, CA | ONSITE/REMOTE | Full Time

The Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, Registry team is looking for a senior Scala software engineer. Our service is architected as an Event-Sourced, Distributed system built on CQRS principles. Our technology stack is Scala / Akka / Play. If you have ever wondered what it is like to apply Functional Programming principles in a live, production environment this is the role for you.

The Registry service is a managed, multi-tenant registry for Docker container images for customers who want to store and launch their containers on OCI, including Kubernetes users. In addition to working on interesting projects and the future of OCIR, you'll be getting a great salary, flexible working arrangements, a fun, state-of-the-art development environment and excellent opportunities for learning and career growth. Members of our team work on distributed systems in a cloud environment and have ownership of our service from top (Load Balancers) to bottom (Databases).

Please contact justin.ko@oracle.com

items.content:
Job Description

Senior Vlocity and Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality.?

Competitive Advantage

Since 2005, Eagle Creek has leveraged US based on-shore/off-site Consultants in our multiple Technology Centers.? This has given us the ability to provide our customers with a cost-comparable alternative to off-shoring for many reasons:
  • Technology Centers in the heart of the United States
  • No more than 2 time zones away from the customer
  • No more than a half day trip to inspect a project or engagement
  • Dedicated technological focus ? CRM, BI, eCommerce
  • Six month training programs for every consultant
  • The capability of delivering any phase and any size engagement
  • Supported by the most extensive onsite consulting team in the industry
Value Proposition

Eagle Creek has over 2,500,000 hours of project experience spanning over 300 engagements. It is one of the only companies in the world with the experience and capabilities to successfully deliver multi-million dollar engagements remotely. The company?s value proposition is based exclusively on Quality?and?Price, where customers receive the highest quality in the industry at a price that is more cost effective than offshore and lower than traditional onsite service companies. The company?s Valley City, North Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on CRM and related technologies while the Pierre, South Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on Business Intelligence technologies, and the Vermillion, South Dakota and Eden Prairie, Minnesota Project centers focus on eCommerce development.

Duties
  • Participate in the development of? Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek?s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables?with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required
  • Additional duties as required
Required Technical Skills
  • Some Vlocity experience or certification(s)
  • Bachelor?s degree in computer science, related field, or equivalent
  • 2+ years experience with end to end Salesforce.com implementations, integrations, and enhancement projects
  • 2+ years APEX and Visualforce development for custom Salesforce functionality
  • Experience integrating business processes across disparate systems and multiple Salesforce instances using web services, SOAP, XML, REST, MSMQ, workflow, XML, HTML, UML and JavaScript
  • Development of? custom objects, fields and formulas, custom reports, and dashboards
  • Integration experience with other Salesforce Applications and External systems
  • Development of SOAP and REST based web services used for custom development
  • Solid understanding of SaaS and CRM development processes and methodologies
  • Create supporting technical documentation and detailed design specifications
  • Develop and maintain validation rules and custom workflows
  • Salesforce development certification (highly desired)
  • Hands-on development skills
  • Knowledge about OOTB functionality and the ability to discern when to configure over code
Desired Technical Skills
  • 1+ years Vlocity development experience
  • Design and development of applications using the Force.com IDE
  • Java based web application development and OOP skills
  • Jitterbit or Informatica Cloud adapter for Salesforce
  • Certified Advanced Developer
Eagle Creek is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
This position is responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of Salesforce and other custom database and EDI applications.

Will office in Reston, VA

ESSENTIAL DUTIES RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

  • Customize SQL-based database application solutions within the Salesforce platform to support business functions and meet project objectives and company goals.
  • Manage daily support and maintenance of our Salesforce instance, SQL application and conduct long-term improvements and upgrades.
  • Communicate and collaborate with project managers and user stake-holders to design intelligent and effective business solutions.
  • Provide system administration support of internal and customer-facing Salesforce environment, especially related to customized applications, user permissions, security settings, custom objects, workflows and daily data transfers.
  • Work with IT team to develop business requirements, process flows, and application designs.
  • Integrate Salesforce with other existing business applications.
  • Write SQL queries for application-based searches and reports.
  • Develop user-requested reports, dashboards, forms, views and new data fields.
  • Create and update workflows as requirements change.
  • Develop and maintain API code and s-controls to support custom development interfaces.
  • Develop programs in Salesforce Apex, Javascript and other supporting languages and APIs.
  • Develop and maintain programs in the AS/400 environment using RPG.
  • Assist in the migration of code, processes, business and business logic from the AS/400 environment to other platforms.
  • Serve as primary point of contact for developing and prioritizing all change requests, system alterations, and customization.
  • Partner with cross functional teams to produce requirements and designs for business capabilities that align to company s business and technology strategies providing guidance on Salesforce matter expertise.
  • Create and maintain documentation of key project artifacts, processes and system functionality/tools.
  • Own Salesforce Administration responsibilities and hands on implementation of all administration needs from beginning to end.
  • Generate visualization and reports/dashboards on Salesforce to satisfy business reporting requirements.
  • Monitor new Salesforce release features and functionality and provide recommendations for process improvements.
  • Coordinate testing, upgrades and configuration of system files and services.
  • Assist in the technical rollout of future enhancements.
  • Other design, development and programming duties as assigned.
  • Other IT related duties and responsibilities as requested.

QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS AND/OR EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Applied Science, Math, Business Analytics, Project Management, Business or a related discipline or equivalent experience and certifications preferred.
  • 3+ years of experience with Salesforce in a solutions development and maintenance capacity.
  • 3+ years of experience designing, developing and maintaining SQL-based business database application.
  • Multiple Salesforce project deployments including release and environment management a big plus.
  • Current Salesforce certifications ADM-201, DEV 401, DEV501 a plus and preferred.
  • Proficient with Salesforce Lightning Experience, Apex, VisualForce, Native, MySQL and JavaScript
  • Proficient with SQL applications, queries and reports.
  • Project Management Institute Program Management Professional (PgMP) or Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, Project Management Agile Practitioner (PMI-ACP) or equivalent project management or business analyst certification preferred.
  • Experience with AS/400 iSeries and RPG a big plus.
  • Experience and expertise in communicating with user stakeholders and non-technical staff.
  • Demonstrated experience designing and deploying custom developed solutions on the Salesforce platform.
  • Hands-on experience with Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.
  • Experience using integrated development environments (IDE).
  • Experience managing deployment and understanding deployment best practices.
  • Experience writing code which integrates directly with webservices.
  • Experience with Data Specialist Inc. Dairy ERP (DSI) SQL-based business application a big plus.
  • Experience with AS/400 iSeries and RPG a big plus.

Other Skills and Abilities

  • Background in SDLC/Agile development methodologies.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a cross functional team environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail and complex problem-solving capabilities.
  • Competency in documenting business requirements.
  • Comfortable being the resident in-house Salesforce expert.
About United Global Technologies:

2017 Based on our past performance with the Department of Energy (DOE), UGT was selected into the Mentor Protg program to support Stanford National Accelerator Laboratory (SLAC) in California.
2 UGT secured 400% growth over this 3-year period.
2 Inc. Magazine has named UGT to its 500/5000 list of top IT service companies in the US for six straight years.
2018 UGT has been honored as a Proven Performer in the ZeroChaos Performance Excellence Program.

items.content:
SELECT SOURCE INTERNATIONAL

Select Source International (SSI) has been serving major corporations for more than 15 years. At SSI, we believe in building a corporation with only the strongest and most capable individuals. Our world-class consultants have the expertise to meet our clients demands. Here at SSI, we pride ourselves on the fundamental belief that our team is essential to our company's growth. We assist our consultants every step of the way in order to match them to the best possible position for their skills.

Job Role: SAS Programmer

Location: Groton, CT (100% remote option)

Duration: 6 Months


Job Description:

Performs all SAS programming required for clinical trial analysis and reporting.

Ensures that activities and processes performed are conducted according to sponsor requirements.

Works closely with the Biostatistics and Data Management departments on various clinical projects.

Leads programming efforts for large complex studies.

Requires time management skills, and strong SAS programming expertise.

Reviews case report form (CRF) design. Designs and/or reviews database structure.

Writes edit checks from the Data Cleaning Plan (DCP) specifications.

Creates derived-analysis datasets.

Executes analyses specified in the Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) or Report and Analysis Plans (RAP) under the guidance of the project statistician.

Acts as primary programmer to produce tables, listings, and figures for the clinical study report (CSR).

Acts as secondary programmer to validate SAS programs that produce derived-analysis datasets and data analyses. Years of Experience 5-7.

A productive, hands on programmer who applies technical knowledge and practical experience to deliver statistical programming deliverables to support assets and study teams with limited supervision early in role and independently later in role.

Ensures excellence in the programming of analysis ready datasets, tables, listings, and figures for which they are responsible Ensures adherence to high quality programming standards in their daily work.

Accountable for the quality and timely delivery of datasets and displays required for their clinical study reports as well as other asset level deliverables they may be programming

Ensures appropriate documentation and QC across the lifespan of the study for all of their programming deliverables

Exhibits routine and occasionally complex problem solving skills, seeking direction when appropriate.

Works with statisticians and programming leads to ensure clear specifications for their programmed deliverables are in place.

Will be knowledgeable in core safety standards as well as TA standards pertinent to their project, may aid in development of standards necessary for their study

May contribute to department level initiatives.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor or Master (preferred) Degree in Statistics, Biological Sciences, IT, or related field.

At least 3 years relevant experience in a pharmaceutical, biotech, CRO, or Regulatory Agency.

Statistical Programming and SAS hand-on experience

Clinical trials expertise with an understanding of data operations required for the reporting of clinical trial data.

items.content:
Stefanini is looking for a REMOTE Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer. This role is responsible for delivering high quality technical work, including setup, code, configuration, and validation, to enable a large-scale, complex implementation of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud. The person in this role MUST have extensive Marketing Cloud development and implementation experience, and be able to confidently design & enable complexities beyond a simple CRM connection - for example, multi-org connections, conflicting visibility requirements when connecting to a Salesforce CRM system, roles, sharing & visibility in CRM and their effects on marketing, migration from other marketing systems, etc.

The role is comprised of two main elements: requirements review & technical design, in collaboration with the lead technical architect and functional/business team members, and completion of configuration and development efforts in a timely and effective manner, while working with other US-based and offshore development team members.

This implementation of the Marketing Cloud will be completed in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with multiple stakeholders, an international virtual team, and a tight series of deadlines; this role must be collaborative, a self-starter and team player, who can help drive the team to succeed and who is willing to pitch in wherever necessary to help the team get to Done.

Responsibilities:

Attend daily Agile standups and provide concise updates regarding completed effort and any blockers or concerns

Quickly come up to speed on a large and complex multinational Salesforce CRM implementation, to best advise on Marketing Cloud design & setup needs

Complete setup of environment, connection to CRM, configuration of business units & other critical Marketing Cloud functionality, development **in both the CRM and the Marketing systems** to enable required business outcome

Join selected meetings with business users to understand requirements

Interface with US-based and offshore team members, with clean handoffs of code & other responsibilities, to ensure effective development

5+ years experience in software development life cycle

5+ year experience in Salesforce development and implementing Marketing systems

3+ years experience with Exact Target/Salesforce Marketing Cloud

Salesforce Administrator certification, Salesforce Developer Certification, and Marketing Cloud Consultant certification

Experience in enterprise-level Salesforce projects using agile software development methodologies throughout the whole life cycle with repeated and demonstrable success

Expert level understanding of the Salesforce Sales and Marketing Cloud solutions, as well as the Force.com Platform. Lightning experience a plus but not required.

Experience with Salesforce Development and general salesforce components such as objects, fields, workflow rules, field updates, process builder, apex classes, triggers, test classes, etc.

Must be strong in various Marketing Cloud areas - Email Studio, Automation Studio, Mobile Studio, Journey Builder, MC Connect, Audience Builder, Data Extensions, etc.

Experience with object-oriented program languages especially strong in APEX, Visualforce, HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery, SOQL and SQL queries.

Must have AmpScript experience.

Knowledge or exposure to Marketing Cloud Connect Integration

Experience with managing Campaigns using the Campaign and Campaign Members objects, direct mail integration/data management, and social media/customer service integration

Experience working with Multiple Business Units in Marketing Cloud and knowledgeable about Audience Segmentation

Familiarity with multi-org connector is a huge plus.

Familiarity with Marketing Cloud API is a huge plus.

Eloqua Experience a huge plus.

Education Required: Minimum Bachelor s degree - preferred in Computer Science or related field, but not required (or equivalent experience)

Interested applicants may click the apply button or you may call us at for faster processing. Thank you.
- provided by Dice

items.content:
Job Description
The Company
WorldPay is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the largest payments company in the World, first in PIN Debit transactions and the largest merchant acquirer. Visit Worldpay.com for more.
The Opportunity
As WorldPay grows, our need for skilled and seasoned IT professionals increases. Being a player in the payments processing industry requires a savvy team of experts who can easily navigate the often complex and sophisticated world of billing and the many applications included in a large business. By ensuring our systems are optimal, we can monitor and measure our successes and discover new areas for improvement.
RMB Application Support Engineer -- Will work with third parties and well as operation stakeholders to ensure daily/monthly billing activities within Oracle RMB work as expected. Expected to engage with upstream and downstream application support resources as well as data owners to troubleshoot issues enabling corrective action in a 24/7 environment. Typically requires 3 years of dedicated Oracle RMB experience preferably in a similar environment. WorldPay's fast, continued growth means as our systems become more complex, our need for detail-oriented people deepens.
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At WorldPay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.
The Day-to-Day
Responsibilities:
  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience as an Oracle RMB support resource.
  • 24x7 on-call support, as required to ensure production and operational health of Oracle RMB.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate troubleshooting of advanced technical issues and work cross-organizationally (Development, Database, Server team, Platform and Product) along with other system application teams to resolve stability, performance or serviceability of Oracle RMB.
  • Engage with development on release planning and production readiness
  • Interface with Billing Leadership and interaction with stakeholders across IT and Operations.
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of Worldpay financial processing and develop trusted partnership with Billing Operations and stakeholders within Line-of-Business.
  • Ensure Oracle RMB deliverables meet or exceed all operational metrics (OLAs and SLAs), as defined.
  • Monitor and analyze daily and monthly run cycles.
  • Interact with End Users to address issues in a timely manner.
  • Ability to work within a team, including onshore and offshore resources.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years supporting Oracle RMB
  • Understanding of business financial flows (month end billing, GL, merchant/partner payments, payment calculations, reporting and residual
  • Oracle EBS experience is a plus
  • Tivoli Scheduler experience a plus
  • Basic SQL knowledge is a plus
  • Agile experience is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

items.content:
Salesforce Developer at ExecOnline

Remote | International

Location: Remote

We’re looking for an exceptional individual to join our tech team as a Salesforce Developer. Our enterprise technology stack centers on Sales Cloud and Service Cloud, with integrations to cloud business systems and our innovative EdTech product. We are building an enterprise application in support of a growth-stage startup, across marketing, sales, account management, finance, customer support, and global operations. We’re a small, diverse team with members on three continents, so remote collaboration is a critical skill.

On the Tech Team, we:

  • Have a strong quality culture. High quality, highly maintainable code is extremely important to us.
  • Are totally digging functional programming
  • Aggressively review code and take mentoring each other very seriously
  • Have a very innovative approach to evaluating our skills and how to “level up” as a developer
  • Participate in the tech community and contribute to open source projects including our own – check out our Github – https://github.com/execonline-inc/
  • Participate in at least one full company hackathon every year
  • Don’t work crazy long hours. We want your best every day, and that takes rest and balance.
  • Are committed to learning from each other and teaching each other

What you’ll do:

  • Work on business process automation projects to meet the requirements of contributors and stakeholders across marketing, sales, account management, finance, customer support, and global operations
  • Work in both Classic and Lightning Experience
  • Work on projects that may require front end Lightning Web Components, back end Apex coding, and/or API systems integrations
  • Work on projects that may require declarative features like Process Builder and Flow
  • Work on DevOps projects as we upgrade to the latest SFDX tooling and practices, and work within a dev sandbox and testing sandboxes as part of build/QA/deploy processes
  • Collaborate daily with the whole team and third party developers/consultants
  • Participate in regular discussions on how to improve team’s productivity and efficiency
  • Serve as Salesforce technical liaison to web, mobile, and API product development teams
  • Be an important contributor in higher-level discussions about architecture, infrastructure, design, technology choices, hiring, etc.

What makes you a great fit for this role:

  • You value hard work, collaboration and the ability to strike the right balance between speed, quality and execution
  • You have experience or interest in EdTech
  • You have a deep understanding of and significant experience (more than two years) with the Force.com platform (including Apex batch processing, trigger architecture, governor limits, unit testing, and Salesforce APIs), Visualforce, and JavaScript/Lightning Web Components
  • You have a deep understanding of the declarative capabilities of the Force.com platform, including logic in the model (formula fields, validation rules), Process Builder and Visual Flow
  • You have significant general programming experience (at least five years)
  • You LOVE to code and have a Github/StackOverflow/etc account that proves it!
  • Bonus points for experience with: OwnBackup, DemandTools, Talend, Heroku Postgres

What you’ll get:

  • The opportunity to join a startup on a team with high career-growth potential across the organization
  • A stimulating work environment working with leading-edge, highly-motivated team members
  • Competitive base salary
  • 20 days paid vacation
  • Stock options
  • Highly subsidized health insurance
  • Opportunity to take our courses with elite business schools
  • Great office locations: Union Square in NYC, Downtown DC
  • 2 months paid parental leave
  • 401K with Vanguard
  • Commuter benefits and other perks

About ExecOnline

ExecOnline partners with top business schools, including Berkeley-Haas, Columbia, IMD, MIT-Sloan, Wharton, Chicago Booth, and Yale to rapidly deliver online leadership development programs that generate lasting organizational impact. ExecOnline’s university-certified programs in strategy, innovation, operations, and more feature dynamic content tailored to the unique corporate objectives of their clients. ExecOnline has delivered transformational leadership development experiences to more than 200 organizations and 10,000 business leaders.

Apply for job

Smart Commerce SE ist ein innovativer Anbieter von eCommerce-Lösungen. Unseren Erfolg verdanken wir in erster Linie unseren Mitarbeitern, die in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden maßgeschneiderte eCommerce-Lösungen für den Online-Handel planen, bauen und betreiben.

(Senior) SAP-Commerce-Cloud-Entwickler ehem. Hybris (m/w/d)

Du bearbeitest, eingebunden in ein interdisziplinäres Team, kontinuierlich bestehende und neue eCommerce Projekte inhouse sowie vor Ort bei unseren Kunden.

  • Deine Deutsch- und möglichst auch Englischkenntnisse sind sehr gut in Wort und Schrift

Unser Angebot:

  • Unternehmensbeteiligungen und Mitbestimmung bis in die höchste Unternehmensebene

Das erwartet dich:

The “Smart Way” - Gegenseitiges Vertrauen, Offenheit und Ehrlichkeit, Teamarbeit, die Verpflichtung zu Qualität und Exzellenz, Unabhängigkeit und Mitbestimmung sind feste Bestandteile des Smart Way. Du hast Interesse an der Stelle aber gerade keine Zeit für eine ausführliche Bewerbung? Kein Problem, Lass dich anrufen!

items.content:
Job Description

Senior Vlocity and Salesforce Developer

Eagle Creek Software Services is a CRM, BI, and eCommerce services firm and the largest dedicated provider of on-shore and rural sourcing services in the US. Eagle Creek Software focuses on implementing, upgrading and extending the useful life of CRM, BI, and allied technologies. People are attracted to Eagle Creek for our focus; for our success, (rapid growth since 1999); for the opportunity to work on the largest and most innovative projects in the US with Fortune 1000 clients; and for our reputation for high quality.?

Competitive Advantage

Since 2005, Eagle Creek has leveraged US based on-shore/off-site Consultants in our multiple Technology Centers.? This has given us the ability to provide our customers with a cost-comparable alternative to off-shoring for many reasons:
  • Technology Centers in the heart of the United States
  • No more than 2 time zones away from the customer
  • No more than a half day trip to inspect a project or engagement
  • Dedicated technological focus ? CRM, BI, eCommerce
  • Six month training programs for every consultant
  • The capability of delivering any phase and any size engagement
  • Supported by the most extensive onsite consulting team in the industry
Value Proposition

Eagle Creek has over 2,500,000 hours of project experience spanning over 300 engagements. It is one of the only companies in the world with the experience and capabilities to successfully deliver multi-million dollar engagements remotely. The company?s value proposition is based exclusively on Quality?and?Price, where customers receive the highest quality in the industry at a price that is more cost effective than offshore and lower than traditional onsite service companies. The company?s Valley City, North Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on CRM and related technologies while the Pierre, South Dakota Project Center primarily focuses on Business Intelligence technologies, and the Vermillion, South Dakota and Eden Prairie, Minnesota Project centers focus on eCommerce development.

Duties
  • Participate in the development of? Salesforce applications based on client needs for integration, implementation, and customization projects
  • Mentor and train, formally and informally, Eagle Creek?s Jr. and mid-level resources
  • Foster and maintain development and integration standards, best practices and related deliverables?with the EC team
  • Participate in pre-sales efforts and strategic project planning
  • Ability to travel for initial project set-up and major milestones as required

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Job Description
The Company
WorldPay is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the largest payments company in the World, first in PIN Debit transactions and the largest merchant acquirer. Visit Worldpay.com for more.
The Opportunity
As WorldPay grows, our need for skilled and seasoned IT professionals increases. Being a player in the payments processing industry requires a savvy team of experts who can easily navigate the often complex and sophisticated world of billing and the many applications included in a large business. By ensuring our systems are optimal, we can monitor and measure our successes and discover new areas for improvement.
RMB Application Support Engineer -- Will work with third parties and well as operation stakeholders to ensure daily/monthly billing activities within Oracle RMB work as expected. Expected to engage with upstream and downstream application support resources as well as data owners to troubleshoot issues enabling corrective action in a 24/7 environment. Typically requires 3 years of dedicated Oracle RMB experience preferably in a similar environment. WorldPay's fast, continued growth means as our systems become more complex, our need for detail-oriented people deepens.
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At WorldPay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.
The Day-to-Day
Responsibilities:
  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience as an Oracle RMB support resource.
  • 24x7 on-call support, as required to ensure production and operational health of Oracle RMB.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate troubleshooting of advanced technical issues and work cross-organizationally (Development, Database, Server team, Platform and Product) along with other system application teams to resolve stability, performance or serviceability of Oracle RMB.
  • Engage with development on release planning and production readiness
  • Interface with Billing Leadership and interaction with stakeholders across IT and Operations.
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of Worldpay financial processing and develop trusted partnership with Billing Operations and stakeholders within Line-of-Business.
  • Ensure Oracle RMB deliverables meet or exceed all operational metrics (OLAs and SLAs), as defined.
  • Monitor and analyze daily and monthly run cycles.
  • Interact with End Users to address issues in a timely manner.
  • Ability to work within a team, including onshore and offshore resources.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years supporting Oracle RMB
  • Understanding of business financial flows (month end billing, GL, merchant/partner payments, payment calculations, reporting and residual
  • Oracle EBS experience is a plus
  • Tivoli Scheduler experience a plus
  • Basic SQL knowledge is a plus
  • Agile experience is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

items.content:
Looking for a technically savvy Salesforce Developer with 4+ years exclusively in SFDC platform with a proven track record of working on challenging Force.com product development projects

The Salesforce Developer is expected to contribute and take ownership of all technical aspects involved in delivering Salesforce projects primarily custom code development (Visualforce and Apex), Integration (Web Services SOAP/Rest, ETL and API integration), SFDC Administration, Application & Data Migration, Deployment & Release, Analysis, Design and Documentation.

Responsibilities

* Accountable for systems analysis, technical design, coding, unit testing, data quality and documentation of the assigned project(s)

* Work closely with Solution Architect, Business Analyst, Junior Developers, QA team and transform the requirements to produce detailed technical design documents to match the solution specifications

* Play key role in development activities as a technical expert in Visualforce, Apex, Triggers, SOQL/SOSL, HTML/XML, JavaScript and other technologies to build customized solutions

* Responsible for build, deployment, change management and release management activities

* Participate and lead the project related meetings with customer representative and internal/external stakeholders

* Actively participate in requirements gathering, UAT support, Deployment & Release activities and also should provide Customer Training as and when required

* Shows initiative as a self-starter, organized, committed, excellent research & learning skills, able to handle multiple priorities and possess excellent time management

* Follow and recommend best practices coding standards and development procedures

* Document functional requirements, technical requirements and development process documentations

* Actively contribute, guide and train junior developers knowledge sessions, best practices, innovative ideas and cost effective cutting edge solutions for business problems

Skills & Experience (Mandatory)

* At least 4 years of strong experience in Salesforce com custom development using Visualforce, Apex Classes, Triggers, Bulk Triggers, API based integration, Batch Apex, HTTP Callouts, Test Classes, Design Patterns, SOQL, SOSL, SOAP/REST Web Services

* Java, JavaScript and HTML5 a huge plus

* Work in an Agile Environment

* Strong in OOPs concepts, HTML/CSS, XML, JavaScript

* Should be strong in data modeling skills Relational database design, ERD, normalization, indexing, SQL queries etc. in at least a couple of platforms such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL

* At least 2 years of Salesforce.com (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, AppExchange, Chatter) systems integration and implementation experience with external databases or third party systems like MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP, SharePoint, com, Amazon Cloud Drive, Google Drive integration etc.

* Must have hands-on expertise in one or more of the following Integration technologies g. Informatica, Jitterbit, Cast Iron, ODBC Connectors etc. and API based integration, SOAP, REST Web Services

* Must have SFDC certifications such as DEV401 and/or Dev 501

Qualifications & Education

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent required
  • Force.com, Certified Developer 401
  • Force.com, Certified Administrator 201
    • All Plus Certifications:
  • Salesforce Certified Advanced Administrator
  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer II
  • Salesforce Certified Platform Developer
  • Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder

About Eagle Creek Software Services

Founded in 1999, Eagle Creek Software Services provides consulting and technical expertise to the Enterprise. We focus on CRM, Application Development, Data Integration and BI, helping our clients increase quality and efficiency while managing price and risk in software development, deployment and support.

We’re uniquely positioned by combining on site expertise with our U.S. Onshore delivery platforms. This model utilizes on shore but offsite, technology center based resources, in a model that we developed in collaboration with the state governments of North and South Dakota. Through this approach, we are able to achieve consistency and sustainability in the provisioning of technical and consulting capabilities to our clients.

With over 15 years in business and over 5 million hours of experience, Eagle Creek has expertise in a multitude of industries. From Hospitality to Manufacturing, we have the know-how to implement, upgrade or maintain your technology stack. But if you’re in need of a company with a special understanding, a deep industry expertise, we have that also. Some of the areas/sectors that we excel in include Healthcare, Insurance, Financial Services, Communications, Technology, and Life Sciences.

We’re committed to delivering a technology value proposition that positively impacts our customer and to helping you sustain your front office technology investments. Simply stated, you want the highest quality of services, at the most affordable price, where risk is continuously assessed and mitigated. With all of our years of experience we only know one way to achieve this, and that’s through U.S. Onshore. Nine years ago, when everyone was building offshore facilities, we were investing in U.S. Onshore. Today, we are the innovation leader supporting over 40 different technologies, applications and platforms. CRM, Application Development, BI – Salesforce®, Oracle, Birst, Cognos, Informatica, Java, .NET and Drupal – depth of expertise and breadth of experience.

We’re Eagle Creek – the innovative leader in U.S. Onshore.

If you would enjoy working in a dynamic environment and are looking for an opportunity to become part of a stellar team of professionals, we invite you to apply online today.

items.title: Oracle Financials ORMB Support Engineer (100% Remote)
items.content:
The Company
Worldpay is a global payments leader powering international commerce with deep fintech expertise and a shared passion for our customers. Whether in-store, online, or on a mobile device, we process over 40 billion transactions annually and offer more than 300 payment methods supporting 126 currencies across 146 countries. It's the perfect place for exceptional people to take their careers to the next level.

The Opportunity
As?Worldpay grows, we must be proactive in assuring we stay ahead of the curve with truly cutting-edge products and services. The payments industry is in rapid evolution with the implementation of new technologies. By hiring the best minds that understand that new features and capabilities are just as important as security,?Worldpay will continue to beat the competition with our offerings. Whether it's dedicated to new products and services, or ensuring we have the best infrastructure out there,?Worldpay is dedicated to tech.

RMB Application Support Engineer -- Will work with third parties and well as operation stakeholders to ensure daily/monthly billing activities within Oracle RMB work as expected. Expected to engage with upstream and downstream application support resources as well as data owners to troubleshoot issues enabling corrective action in a 24/7 environment. Typically requires 3 years of dedicated Oracle RMB experience preferably in a similar environment. WorldPay's fast, continued growth means as our systems become more complex, our need for detail-oriented people deepens.
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At WorldPay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.
The Day-to-Day
Responsibilities:
  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience as an Oracle RMB support resource.
  • 24x7 on-call support, as required to ensure production and operational health of Oracle RMB.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate troubleshooting of advanced technical issues and work cross-organizationally (Development, Database, Server team, Platform and Product) along with other system application teams to resolve stability, performance or serviceability of Oracle RMB.
  • Engage with development on release planning and production readiness
  • Interface with Billing Leadership and interaction with stakeholders across IT and Operations.
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of Worldpay financial processing and develop trusted partnership with Billing Operations and stakeholders within Line-of-Business.
  • Ensure Oracle RMB deliverables meet or exceed all operational metrics (OLAs and SLAs), as defined.
  • Monitor and analyze daily and monthly run cycles.
  • Interact with End Users to address issues in a timely manner.
  • Ability to work within a team, including onshore and offshore resources.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years supporting Oracle RMB
  • Understanding of business financial flows (month end billing, GL, merchant/partner payments, payment calculations, reporting and residual
  • Oracle EBS experience is a plus
  • Tivoli Scheduler experience a plus
  • Basic SQL knowledge is a plus
  • Agile experience is a plus
All the above duties and responsibilities are essential job functions for which reasonable accommodation will be made. All job requirements listed indicate the minimum level of knowledge, skills and/or ability deemed necessary to perform the job proficiently. This position description is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Colleagues may be required to perform any other job-related instructions as requested by their leader, subject to reasonable accommodation.

What you will do :

The Care NG CRM Developer will provide high quality operational and technical application development and systems support to customers and internal business functions by analysing, designing and coding, testing and implementing systems to meet customer requirements. Minimising the adverse impact of incidents and problems on the business and preventing reoccurrence of Incidents. Manage the configuration of applications and control of software releases.

The post holder will be responsible for the development and support of applications. Be required to input into all new infrastructure changes that may have an impact on the development and support of applications. Be responsible for maintaining and improving the relationship with external support providers, third party developers and business departments both during the project lifecycle and post go live. As an integral member of the IT team the post holder will be required to assist in all areas of the service provided by the team.

You will be working alongside project managers, infrastructure support, 3rd party contractors and consultants and application analyst whilst providing recommendation to the IT Managers.

Responsibilities & Experience:

o Input into Project plans

o Application Status Reports

o Supporting system & application testing to agreed standards

o Working with project delivery teams to ensure that projects take account of the support implications in relation to new applications or system

o Assists in acceptance and formal sign off of applicable projects

Apply today for the role of Care NG CRM Developer as successful candidates will be contacted within 48 hours.

  • Monitoring, logging, and/or troubleshooting SAS servers, including using system logs or setting logging options as well as options within Environment Manager / SAS Management Console (SMC)
  • Audit, Performance, and Measurement configuration and reporting
  • Troubleshooting basic SAS server issues, such as system access and password problems
  • Understanding SAS installation directory structures, where to find things related to servers, configurations, content, etc.
  • Administering the scheduling of jobs and reports
  • Assisting project teams in SAS AML deployment and testing
  • Using Environment Manager and SMC to administer metadata
  • Administering Enterprise Miner
  • Administering Data Flux
  • Administering Visual Analytics
  • Adding new libraries to the Metadata Server
  • Via SMC, controlling User access to various parts of the SAS system, granting permissions to read, write, create or view reports and data within the system - ensure that Users see only the information that they are authorized to access. Create and configure libraries and permissions for Users and groups of Users, and assign logins. Design, implement, and maintain the security framework (access rights and privileges, User roles / groups, etc.)
  • Performing basic system administration tasks such as monitoring CPU / RAM / Disk space utilization, port utilization and running processes on applicable OS
  • Troubleshooting performance problems in a logical, scientific manner
  • Understanding SAS AML Solution
  • Understanding the concept of SAS repositories, what they are, why they are used and how to create/maintain them
  • Understanding how SAS interacts with third party software such as databases, web application servers, etc.
  • Resetting SAS passwords
  • Assisting with problems pertaining to accessing the SAS server(s) or data
  • Monitoring for availability and then installing updates to SAS software (patches / maintenance releases / hot fixes, etc.)
  • Monitoring and logging SAS servers and spawners, and then optimizing memory usage or tuning servers for optimal performance
  • Creating, modifying, and maintaining various folder structures within SMC
  • Providing knowledge transfer, mentoring and expert advice to the client on the efficient administration of the SAS system
  • Managing the performance of the SAS AML Platform
  • Monitoring and ensuring proper load balancing and prioritizations
  • Experience with GIT/Bitbucket
  • Producing ad hoc reporting on issues and other items as directed by the bank's SAS Systems Manager.
  • Attending meetings as directed by the banks ISA SAS Systems Manager.
  • Performing other general consulting services which may not be described in this SOW but are related to administering the bank's SAS environment, as directed by the bank' s SAS Systems Manager.
- provided by Dice

If you are a Remote Senior Hybris Engineer with experience, please read on!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

7.5 years of software development experience in the areas of e-Commerce (SAP Hybris), Web Content Management (AEM, Apache Sling) and Java/J2EE.

Relevant experience in SAP HYBRIS based e-commerce application development for retail industries.

Worked on Hybris based B2B, B2C and Telco E-Commerce applications.

Worked on Hybris-AEM integration application.

Expertise in Hybris Data Modeling, WCMS, Solr, HMC, CMS Cockpit, Admin Console, Cronjobs, Impex, Catalogs, Categories, Products, PCM, Backoffice.

Expertise in 3rd party systems integration using SOAP/REST services.

Functional requirements analysis and design of technical documents.

Ability to setup end-to-end Hybris environment on cloud-based systems such as AWS.

Java micro services development.

Ability to lead and mentor junior team members and own a module development.

Application performance tuning.

Serve as the conduit between the user community and the software development team through which requirements flow Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates Liaise between the business, technology teams and support teams Basic Qualifications: 5-7 years of Functional experience in SAP FI /CO other related modules Experience in integrating other SAP Modules like MM / PP Ability to unit test development, work closely with business in requirement management / gathering, writing detailed functional specification, manage user expectations and work closely with the cross functional teams to get the job done. items.content:
The main responsibility of the Senior Systems Administrator is to create enhanced workflow for users while maintain and updating the system in response to industry and system updates and changes. Opportunity to work remote.

Job duties include:

  • Documentation and deployment of future system functionality dictated by changes and updates to federal compliance and agency guidelines and procedures in assigned system
  • In-depth examination of release notes and coordinating the deployment of newly-released settings, features and rules with the System Administrator Manager
  • Assist Development Manager, Sys Admin Manager and COO in the Creation of HFC's roadmap for enhanced functionality within assigned system
  • Work with Developers to design and create enhancements within assigned system
  • Review developed system enhancements with Systems Administrator and COO within assigned system
  • Devise and Implement rollout plan approved Systems Administrator Manager and COO
  • Provide assistance to other teams when requested
  • Standard System Administrator duties pertaining to assigned system
  • Achievement of Administration Certification for assigned system

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 5 years of Mortgage Industry Knowledge required
  • Minimum of 3 years of system configuration experience required
  • Encompass administration experience
  • VB.NET, C#, TSQL programming experience preferred
  • Proficient in Microsoft office; advanced Excel skills (calculations, if statements, vlookups, etc.)
  • Ability to complete work independently with little to no instructions and delegate tasks to Systems Administrators and Coordinators
  • Work well under tight deadlines and within fast paced environment
  • Must be able to work with and use a computer screen for 7 - 8+ hours on a daily basis

items.title: Lead Salesforce Developer - Remote at Toptal
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Lead Salesforce Developer - Remote

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Industry: Information Technology, Recruiting, Technology Staffing
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Reactions to this job

0 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Toptal | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 6 hours

Technologies

salesforce
integration
implementation
Bozhidar Batsov 47k 11 85 107
Alexander Danilenko 96 2
Alejandro Rigatuso
Dima Rodionov 1

Job description

As the Lead Salesforce Developer at Toptal, you will work with Engineering, Product, and Business stakeholders to develop and deliver key business results. As a thought leader and resident technical expert, your contributions will help us drive innovation as we rapidly scale and build the future of work.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. All communication and resumes must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities:

You will own the development and technical integrity of Toptal’s Salesforce instance. You will lead the technical integration project between Salesforce and Toptal’s platform. You will also lead all technical initiatives related to Salesforce jointly with your Business Operations counterpart, including building customizations to our Salesforce instance. You will also own release planning and timelines for all Salesforce initiatives. As part of this, you will facilitate any meetings or technical discussions required to make your projects a success, and communicate proactively with your stakeholders around requirements, timelines, and roadblocks.

In the first week you will:

  • Onboard into Toptal and understand who you will be working with and what projects you will be working on first.
  • Start learning about Toptal’s Enterprise business.

In the first month you will:

  • Completely understand Toptal’s Enterprise Sales processes.
  • Be completely familiar with Toptal’s Salesforce instance.
  • Lead your first projects.
  • Have shipped your first Salesforce features.

In the first three months you will:

  • Have shipped your first Salesforce Integration milestone.
  • Have an idea for a roadmap of improvement features you’d like to make for Salesforce.
  • Have an idea about how to improve our sales processes based on your observations and be communicating with your business counterparts proactively on these things.

In the first six months you will:

  • Have completed Salesforce integration milestones.
  • Execute improvement features on the roadmap.
  • Have an established feedback loop with all members of the Sales, Product, and Engineering teams.

In the first year you will:

  • Be responsible for developing and implementing the roadmap for Salesforce.

Requirements:

  • 4+ years of Salesforce development and architecture experience, including strong expertise with Visualforce and Apex programming.
  • Vast knowledge of Salesforce Lightning Platform and core features.
  • Experience with Force.com APIs.
  • Experience integrating Salesforce with other platforms.
  • Experience with exporting Salesforce data for use in third-party reporting tools and/or Einstein is a plus.
  • Salesforce Platform Developer Certification, PDI or PDII (Application Builder is plus).
  • Experience working within B2B sales or services organizations with knowledge of sales best practices.
  • You are thoughtful, diligent, and proactive as a problem solver.
  • Ability to plan and control your own scope of work and not need to receive a task list from someone every day.
  • Have a track record of delivering successful products as an engineer.
  • Have excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Excel at organizing your own tasks and communicating your status.
  • Proficient in managing multiple stakeholders with the ability to communicate expectations in a clear and concise way.
  • Thrive on providing and receiving honest but always constructive feedback.
  • You must be a world-class individual contributor to thrive at Toptal. You will not be here just to tell other people what to do.
Apply now

About Toptal

At Toptal, we value people for their contributions, not their time spent in a chair. We track goals reached, not hours worked, and we don't waste time in useless meetings. We are a completely remote company and foster a culture of relentless problem solving, direct feedback, and constant collaboration.

We analyze ideas rigorously, foster accountability, and have extremely high standards for everything we do. We are deeply invested in making sure Toptal is a place where everyone is continuously growing and learning.

Benefits

  • Remote
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Unlimited Vacation Days
  • No Mandatory Hours
  • Mentorship
  • Travel Any Time, Anywhere
  • No Office Politics

items.title: Ksplice @ Oracle | Full Time | Remote | https://ksplice.oracle.com/ The Ksplice group at Oracle ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=2, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Ksplice @ Oracle | Full Time | Remote | https://ksplice.oracle.com/

The Ksplice group at Oracle develops exciting technology to patch the Linux kernel and applications while they are running, eliminating unplanned downtime for systems running Oracle Linux and keeping up-to-date with known security fixes. We are a distributed team engineers working to provide rebootless updates for supported kernels and "restartless" updates for supported applications. The applications and operations team is responsible for all the services our users interact with as well as keeping the lights on behind the scenes.

We're looking for a software engineer to help us expand the web services we provide to our customers. As a small team with a broad remit, you must be comfortable with the entire stack, from the Linux shell at the bottom to Python and Django (or similar) at the top (bonus points for experience with Terraform or Ansible). You must also be willing to assist with operations tasks. While our goal is to automate everything we can with code, there are times where ssh and the bash command prompt are the best tools for the job.

More information about Ksplice is available at http://ksplice.oracle.com/, and you can contact me by email at travis.jensen@oracle.com if you have any questions. Oracle is an equal opportunity employer.

items.content:
Remote D365 Business Central Support- $90,000
Our client is a hi-tech manufacturer and Dynamics 365 Business Central end user who is in need of a D365 Support expert to help users with the new ERP.
This is a nationally recognized organization in the field of automated technologies, who has a state of the art product line that has helped them expand to the top of their industry. In order to increase efficiency in their production, financial reporting, and supply chain processes, they have implemented Dynamics 365 Business Central.
In this role, you will become an integral part of company decision making, by analyzing current business trends and developing KPIs and Metrics for forecasting and business planning. You will also be the primary in-house resource for ERP support, working with the group's Microsoft VAR on customization efforts and upgrade projects. A key component in this position will be gathering requirements from department leadership, and identifying paths for improvement with D365 and their business process, as well as designing an upgraded system to fit these needs. You will be working within a collaborative group of IT specialists across the country to architect an optimal system for reporting and supply chain tracking.
This is an exciting opportunity to take your career in the MS Dynamics space to the next level!
Your New Role Will Involve:
  • Working with the executive team to analyze areas in the business that need improvement throughout operations and supply chain
  • Supporting and maintaining the company's D365 ERP system
  • Troubleshooting system errors and documenting consistent problems for future enhancement
  • Training users on D365 functionality
  • Coordinating with department leadership to identify business processes and analyze paths for improvement
  • Utilizing Jet Enterprise and Excel for developing advanced, executive reports
What You'll Need:
  • Experience with Dynamics 365 Business Central, Dynamics NAV also a plus
  • ERP implementation experience preferred
  • Experience with MS SQL Server a plus
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel and BI reporting tools
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Great attention to detail
Salary / Benefits:

  • Amazing career growth potential
  • Fun company culture and collaborative work environment
  • Remote flexibility

items.title: Oracle Financials ORMB Support Engineer (100% Remote)
items.content:
The Company
Worldpay is a global payments leader powering international commerce with deep fintech expertise and a shared passion for our customers. Whether in-store, online, or on a mobile device, we process over 40 billion transactions annually and offer more than 300 payment methods supporting 126 currencies across 146 countries. It's the perfect place for exceptional people to take their careers to the next level.

The Opportunity
As?Worldpay grows, we must be proactive in assuring we stay ahead of the curve with truly cutting-edge products and services. The payments industry is in rapid evolution with the implementation of new technologies. By hiring the best minds that understand that new features and capabilities are just as important as security,?Worldpay will continue to beat the competition with our offerings. Whether it's dedicated to new products and services, or ensuring we have the best infrastructure out there,?Worldpay is dedicated to tech.

RMB Application Support Engineer -- Will work with third parties and well as operation stakeholders to ensure daily/monthly billing activities within Oracle RMB work as expected. Expected to engage with upstream and downstream application support resources as well as data owners to troubleshoot issues enabling corrective action in a 24/7 environment. Typically requires 3 years of dedicated Oracle RMB experience preferably in a similar environment. WorldPay's fast, continued growth means as our systems become more complex, our need for detail-oriented people deepens.
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At WorldPay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.
The Day-to-Day
Responsibilities:
  • Minimum of 3+ years of experience as an Oracle RMB support resource.
  • 24x7 on-call support, as required to ensure production and operational health of Oracle RMB.
  • Ability to collaborate and facilitate troubleshooting of advanced technical issues and work cross-organizationally (Development, Database, Server team, Platform and Product) along with other system application teams to resolve stability, performance or serviceability of Oracle RMB.
  • Engage with development on release planning and production readiness
  • Interface with Billing Leadership and interaction with stakeholders across IT and Operations.
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of Worldpay financial processing and develop trusted partnership with Billing Operations and stakeholders within Line-of-Business.
  • Ensure Oracle RMB deliverables meet or exceed all operational metrics (OLAs and SLAs), as defined.
  • Monitor and analyze daily and monthly run cycles.
  • Interact with End Users to address issues in a timely manner.
  • Ability to work within a team, including onshore and offshore resources.
Qualifications:
  • 3+ years supporting Oracle RMB
  • Understanding of business financial flows (month end billing, GL, merchant/partner payments, payment calculations, reporting and residual
  • Oracle EBS experience is a plus
  • Tivoli Scheduler experience a plus
  • Basic SQL knowledge is a plus
  • Agile experience is a plus
All the above duties and responsibilities are essential job functions for which reasonable accommodation will be made. All job requirements listed indicate the minimum level of knowledge, skills and/or ability deemed necessary to perform the job proficiently. This position description is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Colleagues may be required to perform any other job-related instructions as requested by their leader, subject to reasonable accommodation.

items.title: 100% Remote Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware) Developer
items.content:
***100% Remote Opportunity***
**No Corp to Corp Available**

This organization is seeking a Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware) Developer to take over support for their biggest client and new clients. The candidate will be responsible for building high quality sites on the SCC platform. Role will be focused on taking various brands live on an eCommerce site, enhancing features, and communicating with customer. Strong development and architecting experience w/in the SCC (Demandware) platform is a must.

-Write Salesforce Commerce Cloud (Demandware) code for projects on assigned tasks
-Work with Design team to define and implement end-user functionality
-Estimate task complexity and development cost in detail (task assumptions and dependencies) so Project Managers can provide accurate client quotes and allocate resources appropriately
-Analyze requirements and work with Project Managers and clients to determine specific issue details
-Work with Technical Team to write acceptance criteria to ensure software solution meets client expectations
-Regularly communicate with Project Managers regarding task-level ticket status, including updates to project management software to reflect task progress and state
-Review, test, and provide feedback on work by other developers to ensure code quality. Submit ongoing work for review by peers and/or technical lead
-Write client test plans instructing clients how to set up and execute tests against changes made to the software
-Complete training and tutorials to learn new languages and skills to better support clients; ---Research best practices and understands code structure and organization of code
-Identify issues with existing code and proactively suggest recommended changes to prevent challenges in the future
Accumulate domain knowledge around existing clients and projects to assist them with ongoing needs
Prepare project code releases, coordinate changes with client, and send code to production upon approval from quality assurance; provide hotfixes or project releases, as needed
Ensure high-level requirements are gathered to provide guidance to Technical Team for proper story writing
Bring new staff members up to speed on project configuration and prepares them to contribute as part of the technical team
Assign tasks in partnership with Project Managers to ensure all tasks are accomplished

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. items.content:
Senior Salesforce Developer at Billtrust

Remote
  • Job Location(s): US-NJ-Lawrenceville | US-CO-Denver | US-IL-Chicago | US-Any
  • Job ID: 2018-1934

What you’ll do

As a Sr. Salesforce Developer, you will be involved in enhancement projects which support our existing sales, marketing and service platform. We are looking for someone who loves learning and working in a fast-paced environment, is detail oriented and who values the importance of the “big picture.” You are motivated, intellectually curious and are comfortable working with a lean team passionate about designing thoughtful solutions that are efficient, scalable and operate with precision. Your responsibilities will include the following:

  • Configure and maintain processes which streamline the Lead to Customer lifecycle, utilizing Salesforce Sales and Service Clouds.
  • Design and configure new functionality based on business requirements using apex and visualforce, with a focus on solutions which minimize future maintenance and customization.
  • Develop and maintain architecture involving Salesforce and peripheral applications that integrate with Salesforce.
  • Solve complicated process and business problems using an engineering mindset.
  • Perform Salesforce CPQ (Steelbrick) configuration and maintenance. Prior knowledge is not required, but preferred.
  • Assist with SpringCM (a Docusign Company) workflow and template automation. Prior experience is not required.
  • Maintain approval process workflow
  • Leverage various external APIs to provide seamless integration with the core Salesforce instance.
  • Dell Boomi Integration Maintenance (Prior knowledge is not required)

What you’ll bring to the team

  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with Salesforce Development
  • Proficient in SOQL, SOSL, web services (SOAP or REST) and Visualforce/APEX
  • API integration and development experience
  • Salesforce Developer Certification (minimum 501), higher certifications are a plus
  • Ability to develop requirements for applications based on user input and needs
  • Experience with critical areas of enterprise architecture, including integration technologies, single sign-on, and duplicate management
  • Experience with Marketing Automation tools such as Marketo is a plus.
  • Expertise in defining system architecture with a ‘big-picture’ mindset
  • Strong problem solving, priority setting, multi-tasking, analytical, and collaboration skills

What you’ll get

  • Competitive salary, stock options and 401(k) with company match: We appreciate our employees and we make sure they know it.
  • Benefits: We offer full-time employees multiple healthcare packages, including free and low cost options.
  • Open PTO: Work-life balance is important. We believe in giving our employees time to truly relax and recharge.
  • A Lively Culture: Ping-pong, bean bag toss, hackathons – We enjoy friendly competition.
  • Casual Dress: Every day is “Casual Friday,” we want you to be comfortable when you come to work.
  • Minimal Bureaucracy: An entrepreneurial environment of ownership and accountability allows you to get work done.

Who we are

Billtrust is the best-in-class provider of Payment Cycle Management and accounts receivable solutions, helping businesses accelerate Invoice-to-Cash. We provide a flexible, automated, cloud-based product portfolio that meets diverse buyer requirements and speeds cash application through tailored invoice delivery, secure multi-channel payment enablement, and intelligent matching and payment posting. Our platforms process $15B+ annually and help companies like Kraft Foods, New Balance Athletics and Ferguson Enterprises get paid faster and more efficiently. For the past 17 years, we have achieved remarkable success with year-over-year growth and we attribute that growth to our people and culture – We encourage employees to have autonomy, think creatively, share ideas – even with our CEO – and to challenge the status quo every day without a lot of red tape.

Billtrust: Work Hard. Have Fun. Make History.

Apply for job

Description

Who We Are

Sprinklr is 1,500 employees strong, valued at $1.8 billion, and positioned at the forefront of the customer experience management industry. At a time when consumers are connected and empowered like never before, Sprinklr is helping the world’s largest brands provide amazing experiences at every turn.

Sprinklr offers a set of powerful social capabilities that allow our clients to reach, engage, and listen to customers across 24 social channels. We empower entire organizations to work together – across marketing, advertising, research, commerce, and customer care – to manage customer experience at scale.

Sprinklr works with more than 1,000 of the most recognized brands around the world, including Nike, JPMorgan Chase, Verizon, McDonald’s, Microsoft, P&G, and more than 50% of the Fortune 50.

LMS Administrator:

If you know what an LMS is, you’ve administered Cornerstone, as well as at least one other platform, and you want to be part of building out our new LMS (Lyearn) – this could be the perfect fit for you! The ideal candidate is self-disciplined, a problem solver with great customer service skills, and someone with a balance of technical aptitude and creativity. Position can be based in our San Francisco, New York, or Austin office but remote candidates will also be considered if determined to be a skill and culture fit for Sprinklr.

Responsibilities

  • Answer support requests within contracted SLA.
  • Upload and configure SCORM 1.2, SCORM 2004, and xAPI courses.
  • Generate reports, provision users, and assign learnings.
  • Perform a mix of maintenance and support.
  • Document features, technical specifications & responsibilities.
  • Collaborate with larger SprinklrU Learning Services team on overall curriculum strategy.
  • Key contributor to transition to new LMS (Lyearn) – building requirements, QA, enabling learners and team members.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years’ of experience in LMS administration (Cornerstone experience preferred)
  • Experience with SCORM 1.2, SCORM 2004 (3rd edition), xAPI
  • Expertise in front-end technologies (HTML, Javascript, CSS)
  • Experience with Moodle/Canvas a plus
  • Instructional design experience a plus
